p: The aerial parts of the plant were gathered from Yemen (Aljar region) in the summer of 2012. It was identified as Pulicaria jaubertii by the taxonomist Prof. Dr. Abd El-Rahman Saeed Aldabee from Sana‘a University in Yemen. A specimen’s form of the plant was stored in the herbarium of Faculty of Pharmacy, Al-Azhar University in Cairo under the number of P-01. The plant was dried in shade under room temperature prior to the extraction procedure.
